Theme Designer
The theme designer allows the user to independently customize the color scheme of the System interface in the mobile and web versions of the application.
Layout settings
To switch to the theme settings, select "Theme designer" in the
user profile menu
.
The page that opens contains three blocks:
Layout design is a set of system design themes.
The default system theme is "Material".
Custom layouts are design themes created by the application users.
Mobile app theme is the design themes used in the
GreenData mobile app
.
The default system theme is "Mobile Material".
When hovering over the theme, the theme can be copied
, edited
, and deleted
.
The System design themes can be only copied.
The copied theme for the web version of the application will be placed in the "Custom layouts" block, after which it can be edited.
Changing the settings for the design theme is available to the user if they have the "Write"
permissions
for the corresponding instance of the design theme. Otherwise, editing the theme will not be available.
Viewing and editing the settings for the design theme is done via the theme designer, available by clicking
in the theme hover.
The application has the option to use a theme from another application. To do this,
install file
in the
*.guf
format.
Setting up a theme for the web version of the application
The theme designer provides an extensive set of parameters through which the color design of the System interface elements is configured:
application
;
buttons
;
checkboxes
;
navigation bar
;
main menu
;
menu search box
;
forms
;
registries
;
profile
.
First, it is recommended to specify the layout title (it can be edited later).
The display of all text elements of the System interface is configured in the theme designer using a set of the following settings:
Setting
Purpose
Font of the application text
Text font selection from the drop-down list.
The default font is "Clear Sans".
Size
Selecting a value of the font size from the drop-down list.
The default value is 14 size.
Font formatting
Selecting the font formatting. The formatting options:
— bold;
— italics.
The color of the System interface elements is changed by clicking on the color field
, located next to the configurable setting. As a result, a color picker opens with the ability to select the color on the palette or enter a color code in RGBA, HEX and HSVA formats.
App
Setting
Purpose
Text color
Selecting the text color of the following elements:
the main text of object profiles;
flat registries;
attributes as links.
When using the parameter, the color is set using the Color picker that opens with the option to select a color on the palette or enter the color code in RGBA, HEX and HSVA formats.
Logo of the download page
Selecting an image for the download page logo.
Image is uploaded by clicking the "Upload an image or gif" button. After uploading, the selected image will be displayed in place of the button.
Hovering the mouse cursor over the uploaded image will display a hover with
icons to delete and replace the image.
A JPG, PNG, or GIF file can be used as the page logo. When uploading the image in an unsupported format, the System will display the image element instead of the image.
The image size should not exceed 1 MB. Otherwise, the System will show the notification:
In the
SaaS environment
, when using the
Community Edition
license, changing the logo of the download page is not available.
Favicon
Selecting an image for the icon that is located in front of the page name in the browser tab.
Image download is available by clicking on the "Upload an image or gif" button. After uploading, the selected image is displayed instead of the button.
Hovering the mouse cursor over the uploaded image will display a hover with icons
to delete and replace the image.
In the
SaaS environment
, when using the
Community Edition
license, changing the favicon is not available.
Buttons
The shape of the button corners is set in the "Button corners rounding" field. Available values:
XS
S
M
L
XL
Checkboxes
Navigation bar
Main Menu
Setting
Purpose
Logo
Selecting an image to display in the main menu.
Image is uploaded by clicking "Upload Image". After uploading, the selected image is displayed instead of the button.
Hovering the mouse cursor over the uploaded image will display a hover with icons
to delete and replace the image.
Uploading the logo is allowed in JPG and PNG format.
When uploading the image in an unsupported format, the System will display the image element instead of the uploaded image.
The image size should not exceed 1 MB.
Otherwise, the System will show the notification:
In the
SaaS environment
, when using the
Community Edition
license, changing the logo is not available.
Scalability, %
The "Scalability, %" field allows you to change the scale of the logo (the percentage is calculated from the original image size in pixels) and can take values from
5
to
300
.
The scale value is set to 100% by default.
A block of
316
by
43
pixels is provided for the logo, so the edges of the larger image are cropped.
Alignment
Using the buttons
the uploaded image can be aligned to:
the left edge;
the center;
the right edge.
By default, the alignment is set to the left.

Configuring the mobile app
When configuring the
mobile app
theme, the color palette of the app elements is set for light and dark themes.
The theme designer specifies the name of the custom theme and defines the colors (the color palette for the light and dark themes are set in the appropriate sections):
The color is selected using the Color picker on the palette or by entering the color code in RGBA or HEX formats.
main – the main contrasting color of the application, which is used for buttons, the side menu and the header of the home page;
secondary – the color of the application, which is used for icon buttons, attributes, outlines, and lines;
tertiary – the color of the application, which is used for links inside the application;
warning – the color that is used for "warning" type notifications and as a warning marker;
errors – the color that is used for error alerts;
background – the color that is used for the background of cards and registers;
text – the color that is used for the main text, registries, headings in the card and in the registry header.
To save the edits made in the theme designer, click the "Save" button.
If necessary, use the "Reset" button to undo the edits you made and return to the last saved version.
Theme selection
To select the default theme of the application, check the appropriate box.
For the web version of the application, the user has the option to select a theme other than the default one by clicking on the desired theme.
The default theme of the mobile application will be displayed for all users of the application. In case there is no
access permissions
to "Read" the default user theme, the user will be shown the system theme "Mobile Material".
